revised_title: Reevaluation of Nitrogen Iodide Heat of Formation
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the heat of formation of nitrogen iodide by measuring the heat released during its reaction with excess hydriodic acid. They found that the heat of formation of nitrogen iodide is approximately 16.5 kcal/mol. This value is useful for understanding the explosive nature of nitrogen iodide and its chemical properties.
